Package networkHandler

Class ShortestPathList

  • java.lang.Object
    • networkHandler.ShortestPathList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, GraphProperty<java.util.TreeSet<Path>>
    public class ShortestPathList
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphProperty<java.util.TreeSet<Path>>

    This class is responsible to calculate shortest Paths between Nodes in a given Graph.

    For this calculation multiple versions are available through this class:

    1.a) calculating all shortest Paths in the graph, allowing duplicates. The result contains two versions of a Path, one for each direction Node X to Node Y and Node Y to Node X.

    1.b) calculating all shortest Paths in the graph, excluding duplicates. The result contains only one direction of a Path, with ID of origin Node smaller than ID of destination Node.

    2. calculating only shortest Paths between two given Nodes.

    3. Combining Options 1 and 2, first creating a full list of Paths and separating Paths between two given Nodes afterwards. Duplicates can be allowed or excluded as well, without affecting the Paths between given Nodes.

    Author:
    Fabian Grun
    See Also:
    Path, GraphProperty

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShortestPathList

        public ShortestPathList​(Graph graph,
                        boolean noDuplicates)
        Constructor for only calculating all shortest Paths, without creating a separate list for two given Nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - An instance of Graph on which the shortest Paths are to be calculated.
        noDuplicates - A boolean value indicating whether duplicate Paths need to be removed after calculation.

      • ShortestPathList

        public ShortestPathList​(Graph graph,
                        boolean noDuplicates,
                        boolean calculateAll,
                        int nodeId1,
                        int nodeId2)
        Constructor for calculating shortest Paths between two given Nodes. Depending on the parameters, all other shortest Paths are created as well.
        Parameters:
        graph - An instance of Graph on which the shortest Paths are to be calculated.
        noDuplicates - A boolean value indicating whether duplicate Paths need to be removed after calculation.
        calculateAll - A boolean value indicating whether all shortest Paths need to be calculated.
        nodeId1 - ID identifying a Node from which shortest Paths need to be calculated.
        nodeId2 - ID identifying a Node to which shortest Paths need to be calculated.

    • Method Detail

      • printToConsole

        public void printToConsole()

        Method for printing the calculated result(s) as a message to the console.

        The method calls the Path.printToConsole() for each calculated shortest Path.

        Specified by:

      • printToConsoleTwoNodes

        public void printToConsoleTwoNodes()

        Method for printing the result of the calculation for two given Nodes to the console.

        If an incorrect input was provided, an appropriate error message is returned instead.

      • getValue

        public java.util.TreeSet<Path> getValue()

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The value calculated by the GraphProperty.run() method.

      • run

        public void run()

        Method responsible for the actual calculation of the property value(s).

        The method calculates the shortest Paths following Djikstra's Algorithm. If calculating all Paths, every Node is used once as an origin for the algorithm.

        For this a mapping of parent Nodes is used to find suitable parents on the Path for each Node. From this mapping a reverse mapping is created and given to the createPaths(TreeMap, TreeMap, int, ArrayList) method for recursive creation of the Paths.

        Even if duplicates are to be excluded, they are calculated first and removed afterwards, because the recursive creation requires creation of all possible shortest Paths.

        Specified by:
        run in interface GraphProperty<java.util.TreeSet<Path>>
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
